column2: TENNESSEE DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column4: Tennessee
column6: TN

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column4: possible hazards on roadways.
column6: no passing zones.

column2: 2. To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
column4: don't look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.
column6: stay focused on the center line on the road.

column2: 3. Implied Consent Law means that:
column4: road signs, markings and signals present are implicitly valid even if not present.
column6: if asked by an officer, you will take a test to determine alcohol or drug content in your blood.
column8: you may refuse to field sobriety tests.

column2: 4. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column4: stop in the right lane.
column6: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.

column2: 5. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.

column2: 6. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column4: green and white.
column6: brown and white.

column2: 7. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 8. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you can reduce fuel consumption.
column6: you increase the chance of a crash.
column8: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 9. Green and white signs:
column4: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column6: give information about directions and distances.
column8: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Road curves ahead
column6: Detour ahead

column2: 11. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 12. Driving at night is more dangerous because:
column4: your reaction time is slower.
column6: you cannot see as far ahead at night.

column2: 13. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column4: drinking coffee.
column6: not to drink over a period of time.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 15. A curb painted red means:
column4: No parking or stopping
column6: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off
column8: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

column2: 16. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column6: Leave the road immediately.
column8: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 17. Slow moving vehicles shall turn or pull off the roadway when there are ________ vehicles in line behind them?
column4: five or more
column6: at least four

column2: 18. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 19. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column8: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 20. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column6: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column8: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.

column2: 21. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: that a tire blowout is about to occur.
column6: of a brake failure.

column2: 22. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
column6: you cannot pass.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: You must bear either right or left
column6: A 3-way intersection is ahead
column8: A road joins from the left

column2: 24. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
25. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are permitted
column6: Right turn is not permitted
column8: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 26. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column6: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 27. As the percentage of alcohol in your blood (BAC) increases, you become:
column4: more sober.
column6: more intoxicated.

column2: 28. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column6: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 29. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column4: red lights.
column6: red warning lights.

column2: 30. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: get off the road and check your tires.
column6: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
